column1: In most cases a vein on the inside of the elbow or the back of the hand is used.
First, the site where blood will be drawn is cleaned with germ-killing medicine (antiseptic).
Then, the health care provider wraps an elastic band around the upper arm to apply pressure to the area and make the vein swell with blood.
The elastic band is removed from your arm.
It may also be used to: - Diagnose certain autoimmune disorders - Determine relationships between children and parents when such relationships are in question - Monitor treatment with some medicines
You have a small set of HLAs that are passed down from your parents.
For example, HLA-B27 antigen is found in many people (but not all) with ankylosing spondylitis and Reiter syndrome.
